column5: I know you can't bring potatoes over the border, but what about sweet potatoes?
I think it's anything that grows underground.

It has to do with soil on the object that you are bringing across the border and the possibility that the soil could have some microbe on it that could be introduced to Canada. Therefore, root crops in general are not allowed across the border unless they have been processed in some way.
It is only potatoes ( Canadian are terrified of tubers).lol
Thanks guys. I appreciate the information. Tight lines. Neal
Canned sweet potatoes would be fine
